p.style: border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 115, 174); padding: 0px 0px 4px; margin: 18px 0px 15px; text-align: left;
p.span: Welcome to the Portola Valley School District

Nestled in the foothills behind Stanford University, the Portola Valley School District is home to approximately 550 TK - 8th grade students. We are proud of our two award-winning schools: Ormondale (TK - 3rd) and Corte Madera (4th - 8th).
Mission Statement: PVSD nurtures each child’s academic, physical, social, and emotional growth by providing a comprehensive curriculum, high quality instruction, and personalized support in a collaborative environment that values diverse perspectives and promotes equity.

p.style: font-size: 13.3333px; border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 115, 174); padding: 0px 0px 4px; margin: 18px 0px 15px;

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; cursor: pointer; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

a.title: PVSD's COVID-19 FAQ page
a.strong: Click here for PVSD's COVID-19 FAQ page.

span.a: Meal service for students during campus closure

span.style: font-size: small; white-space: pre-wrap; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);
white-space: pre-wrap; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);
white-space: pre-wrap; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

span.span: PVSD has transitioned to Distant Learning at both Ormondale and Corte Madera Schools, which will continue through the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

span.strong: Parent Tips on Distance Learning by the PTO

span.span:
April 14, 2020: Revised Shelter in Place Order from San Mateo County Health and the San Mateo County Office of Education.
April 7, 2020: Press Release from the San Mateo County Office of Education: Bay Area Campuses to Stay Closed for Remainder of School Year.
March 31, 2020: Revised Shelter in Place Order from San Mateo County Health and the San Mateo County Office of Education.
March 25, 2020: Press Release from the San Mateo County Office of Education: Student Dismissals From Regular School Attendance To Be Extended Until May 1, 2020.
March 16, 2020: Order of the Health Officer of the County of San Mateo County Directing All Individuals Living in the County to Shelter at their Place of Residence Except that they May Leave to Provide or Receive Certain Essential Services

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); letter-spacing: normal; border-bottom: 2px solid rgb(0, 115, 174); padding: 0px 0px 4px; margin-top: 18px;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; font-size: 13.3333px; letter-spacing: normal;

span.style: font-size: small; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(40, 40, 40);

p.span: The PVSD uses BoardDocs which allows the District to maximize the effectiveness of its Board meetings, and public access to meeting Minutes, Agendas, and Policies in an effort to increase transparency and provide easier access to information. The Board Docs link below will lead to immediate access of all Board related information.
